1. Select the `json` file containing the transformation rules.
        - For further instructions on how to create the file click the **_Project description_** tab.
    1. Enter the term you want to transform and hit `enter`.
    1. Click on a word to see its chain of transformations.
        - **_Include intermediate terms_** shows all intermediate steps of the term transformation, not only the final result.
        - If a result term can be obtained through several chains of transformations, only the transformations of the first chain found will be shown.

    1. Introduce el t√©rmino que quieras transformar y pulsa `intro`.
    1. Haz clic en una palabra para comprobar su cadena transformaciones.
        - **_Incluir los t√©rminos intermedios_** muestra todos los pasos intermedios de la transformaci√≥n del t√©rmino, no √∫nicamente el resultado final.

This example illustrates the transformation of the Latin term **`l√≠tteram`**. (The accent mark is used to indicate the stressed vowel).
Este ejemplo ilustra la transformaci√≥n del t√©rmino latino **`l√≠tteram`**. (La tilde marca la vocal t√≥nica).

- The rules used for this transformation have been extracted from "_[Verba. Ejercicios de etimolog√≠a
latina](https://www.unex.es/organizacion/gobierno/vicerrectorados/vicealumn/funciones/car_20050411_001/coordinacion-ebau-2022-23/materias/latin-ii-1/leyes_evolucion_fonetica_modif_.pdf)_" (PDF). However, not all rules have been implemented for this demonstration.
- Use the accent mark to denote the stressed vowel in Latin.
